faq.question: How much can I save with solar in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: East Longmeadow homeowners typically save $1,200-$2,000 annually on electricity bills. Over 25 years, that's $30,000-$50,000 in total savings. Add the competitive pricing ($3,900-$9,100 immediate savings), SMART program payments ($20,000-$30,000 over 10 years), and annual net metering income ($1,400-$2,400), and the financial benefits are substantial.

faq.question: What solar financing is available in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: East Longmeadow residents can choose from: (1) Solar Loans - own your system with zero-down financing, qualify for all benefits; (2) Solar Leases - fixed monthly payments with no upfront costs; (3) PPAs - pay only for electricity produced; (4) Cash Purchase - upfront payment for maximum ROI.

faq.question: Can I get solar with no money down in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: Yes! Zero-down solar financing is available through loans, leases, and PPAs. Zero-down solar loans are popular because you own the system immediately, qualify for the competitive pricing and financing options, and monthly payments are often lower than electricity costs.

faq.question: Will solar increase my property taxes in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: No! Massachusetts provides a 100% property tax exemption for solar systems for 20 years. While solar increases your East Longmeadow home's value by 3-4%, you won't pay additional property taxes.

faq.question: What is the payback period for solar in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: The average payback period in East Longmeadow is 6-9 years, factoring in the competitive pricing, SMART payments, net metering income, and electricity savings. After payback, solar panels continue generating free electricity for 15-20+ years.

faq.question: How does the Massachusetts SMART program work?
faq.answer: The SMART program pays East Longmeadow solar owners for every kWh produced for 10 years. Rates typically range from $0.25-$0.35/kWh. A 7kW system produces about 8,000-8,500 kWh annually, earning $2,000-$2,975 per year.

faq.question: What are net meterings worth in Massachusetts?
faq.answer: net metering represent 1,000 kWh of solar production, sellable at historically $200-$300. A 7kW system in East Longmeadow produces 7-8 net metering annually, generating $1,400-$2,400 in additional yearly income.

faq.question: How does net metering work in East Longmeadow?
faq.answer: Net metering credits you at full retail rates for excess solar electricity sent to the grid. Credits accumulate and offset electricity purchased during nighttime or cloudy periods.
